TD890-d-03-06-90-RFP.Primary Accident Cause: Interaction of lateral/vertical forces (includes harmonic rock off)
TD890-d-03-06-90-RFP.Accident Cause: Interaction of lateral/vertical forces (includes harmonic rock off)
TD890-d-03-06-90-RFP.Narrative: AT 7:30 A.M., TUESDAY MARCH 6, 1990 TRAIN NO. 406 DERAILED THE FOLLOWING ELEVEN CARS AT THE NO. 11 SWITCH IN "GN" INTERLOCKING: PTLX 15944 LOADED COVERED HOPPER (WHEELS R&L-1&2), CSXT 245843 LOADED COVERED HOPPER (ALL WHEELS), AN 2045 LOADED BOX (ALL WHEELS), CIRR 91140 LOADED BOX (ALL WHEELS), CR 580466 LOADED GONDOLA (ALL WHEELS), BO 835120 LOADED COVERED HOPPER (ALL WHEELS), LEF 2523 EMPTY HOPPER (ALL WHEELS), CSXT 941732 LOADED GONDOLA (ALL WHEELS), CSXT 477635 LOADED GONDOLA (ALL WHEELS), GATX 39462 LOADED TANK (ALL WHEELS), GATX 39133 LOADED TANK (WHEELS R&L AND R-2). CRANEMASTER WAS CALED TO RERAIL EQUIPMENT WITH ASSISTANCE FROM BRYAN PARK TERMINAL MECHANICAL FORCES. THERE WAS MAJOR DAMAGE TO TRACK AND EQUIPMENT. WEATHER WAS CLOUDY AND 40 DEGREES. FINAL INVESTIGATION REVEALED THAT CSXT 245843, LOADED COVERED HOPPER, WAS THE FIRST CAR TO DERAIL. HARMONIC ROCK CAUSED THE LEAD WHEEL,LEAD TRUCK, EAST SIDE TO LIFT. CONTRIBUTING FACTORS WERE THE SPEED OF THE TRAIN THE TYPE OF CAR (WHICH HAS A TENDENCY TO ROCK) AND A SECTION OF JOINTED RAIL JUST AHEAD OF THE TURNOUT SETTING UP THE ROCKING MOTION. ALSO CONTRIBUTING TO THE CAUSE WAS A WORN SWITCH POINT.NoneNoneNone

901-d-03-15-90-DSRC.Narrative: THIS ACCIDENT OCCURED ON A 0.33% DOWNGRADE AND IN A 0 DEGREE 30 MINUTE CURVE. DUE TO SOFT SUBGRADE CAUSED BY SATURATED SOIL, THE OUTSIDE RAIL'S ELEVATION WAS BELOW THE INSIDE RAIL. THE 3RD AXLE OF THEFOURTH CAR HIT THIS LOW SPOT AND THE 3RD WHEEL ON THE INSIDE OF THE CURVE CLIMBED THE RAIL AND THEFLANGE RODE THE TOP OF THE RAIL FOR TWO RAIL LENGHTS. IT THEN FELL BACK DOWN SPREADING THE RAILS ANDRODE BETWEEN THE RAILS FOR ANOTHER 5 RAIL LENGTHS UNTIL THE RAIL BROKE AND THE TRAILING CAR NEXT DERAILED BOTH TRUCKS. ONCE THIS HAPPENED THE LAST CAR'S LEAD TRUCK STARTED TO DIG INTO THE GROUND ANDCAUSED IT TO TURN OVER.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

031590A-d-03-15-90-ATK.Primary Accident Cause: Failure to properly secure hand brake on car(s) (railroad  employee)
031590A-d-03-15-90-ATK.Accident Cause: Failure to properly secure hand brake on car(s) (railroad  employee)
031590A-d-03-15-90-ATK.Narrative: ON MARCH 15, 1990, EBY-1 WITH A CREW OF THREE PULLED WEST WITH FIVE CARS. SHOVING BACK ON 11 LEAD ASINGLE CAR SLEEPER 2988 WAS SET OFF ON THE LEAD. THEN TWO CARS WERE SET OFF ON 5 LEAD. AS CREW WAS MOVING WEST OFF 5 LEAD APPROACHING 11 LEAD SLEEPER 2988 BEGAN MOVING WEST ON 11 LEAD AND STRUCK COACH21122 APPROXIMATELY 20 FEET FROM THE WEST END OF 21122 CAUSING 2988 TO DERAIL ON THE B END TO THE SOUTH. THE INVESTIGATION CONDUCTED AFTER THE INCIDENT REVEALED THE CONDUCTOR OF EBY-1 FAILED TO PROPERLY SECURE THE HANDBRAKES ON 2988 AFTER SETTING CAR OFF ON 11 LEAD. THE AIR BLEED OFF ALLOWING CAR TO ROLL WEST AND STRIKING COACH 21122 ON THE SOUTH SIDE FORCING 2988 TO DERAIL TO THE SOUTH. THE ENTIRE CREW WAS REMOVED FROM SERVICE FOLLOWING THE INCIDENT AND WERE GIVEN BREATH AND URINE TESTS. TESTING WAS DONE USING OUR OWN AUTHORITY ALL RESULTS WERE NEGATIVE. THE CONDUCTOR WAS ASSESSED AND DISCIPLINED AS A RESULT OF THIS INCIDENT.NoneNoneNoneNoneNone
